availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry F. Farrier (Lyon County, Kentucky, soldier.)

body.p: Lyon County, Kentucky, laborer and soldier. Tennessee native. Son of Needom Farrier and Barbara Farrier. Laborer in Lyon County, Kentucky, in 1860. Household owned three enslaved persons in Lyon County in 1860. Served in Captain Cobb's Company of the Kentucky Light Artillery (C.S.A.).

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, p. 703.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, City/District, p. 412B.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0074.
KYR-0001-029-0148
